tutorial.closeConfirm: Close tutorial? You can continue it later.

step1.title: Rotate with Mouse
step1.description: üëÜ Right-click and drag to rotate the camera around the space.
step1.action: Right-click + drag to rotate the view
step1.success: Perfect! Now you know how to rotate the camera.
step1.failure: Try right-clicking and dragging the mouse.
step1.hint2: üî• The view will rotate around the space
step1.hint3: ‚ö†Ô∏è If the camera gets stuck, press key C to reset

step2.title: Zoom
step2.description: üñ±Ô∏è Use the mouse wheel to zoom in or out.
step2.action: Use the mouse wheel to zoom
step2.failure: Try zooming with the mouse wheel.

step3.title: Move with Keyboard
step3.description: ‚å®Ô∏è Press W/A/S/D/E/Q to move the camera in space.
step3.action: Press W, A, S, D, E, Q to move
step3.success: Great! You can now move through space.
step3.failure: Press W (forward), A (left), S (back), D (right), E (up), Q (down).

step4.title: Move Fast
step4.description: ‚ö° Hold Shift while moving to speed up.
step4.action: Hold Shift + WASD to move fast
step4.failure: Press Shift + W to move faster.

step5.title: Create Your First Sound Object
step5.description: üéµ Now you'll learn to create sound objects. The left panel has been unlocked.
step5.action: Create a sound object using the left panel
step5.success: Excellent! You've created your first sound object.
step5.failure: Use the left panel to create an object.
step5.hint1: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Open the left panel by clicking the arrow
step5.hint3: 3Ô∏è‚É£ Click the 'CUBE' button to create your first object
step5.hint4: 4Ô∏è‚É£ The object will appear in the 3D space
step5.hint5: üéµ Each object has its own associated sound

step6.title: Use Gizmos to Transform Objects
step6.description: üéØ Learn to use gizmos (visual controls) to move, rotate and scale objects.
step6.action: Use the gizmos to transform objects
step6.success: Perfect! You now know how to use gizmos.
step6.failure: Try selecting an object and using the gizmos.
step6.hint1: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Click on an object in the 3D space to select it
step6.hint2: 2Ô∏è‚É£ Colored gizmos will appear around the object
step6.hint7: 4Ô∏è‚É£ Drag the colored controls to transform
step6.hint8: 5Ô∏è‚É£ Press ESC to exit edit mode
step6.hint9: 6Ô∏è‚É£ Press DELETE to remove the selected object

step7.title: Experiment with Spatial Audio
step7.description: Approach and move away from sound objects to perceive how audio changes according to your position (3D spatial audio).

step8.title: Edit Audio Parameters
step8.description: Customize object sounds using the right panel. Modify frequency, Attack, Decay, Sustain and Release.
step8.action: Use the Audio Parameters section to change object parameters
step8.success: Great! You now know how to customize audio parameters.
step8.failure: Modify parameters using the Audio Parameters section.
step8.hint1: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Select an object in the 3D space
step8.hint3: 3Ô∏è‚É£ Use the sliders to modify parameters like frequency, Attack, Decay, Sustain, Release, waveform, modulation, etc.

step9.title: Edit Visual Appearance
step9.description: Customize the object's visual appearance by modifying its color, material and animation.
step9.action: Use the Color and Material section to change the object's appearance
step9.success: Great! You now know how to customize visual appearance.
step9.failure: Modify the object's color or material using the Color section.
step9.hint1: Experiment with different materials, colors and animations

step10.title: Spatial Effect Zones
step10.description: Create effect zones that apply different audio processing according to object proximity. Click on a zone to edit its parameters.
step10.action: Create an effect zone using the left panel and edit its parameters
step10.success: Excellent! You now know how spatial effect zones work.
step10.failure: Create an effect zone using the left panel and edit its parameters.
step10.hint1: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Use the left panel to create effect zones
step10.hint2: 2Ô∏è‚É£ Click on the created effect zone
step10.hint3: 3Ô∏è‚É£ The right panel is enabled to edit effect parameters
step10.hint4: 4Ô∏è‚É£ Zones only affect objects that are inside them

step11.title: Mobile Objects
step11.description: Create mobile objects that move through space and activate sound objects when passing near them.
step11.action: Create a mobile object and sound objects like cones that activate when the mobile object passes nearby
step11.success: Perfect! You now understand how mobile objects work.
step11.failure: Create a mobile object and sound objects that activate with movement.
step11.hint1: 1Ô∏è‚É£ First create a mobile object using the left panel
step11.hint2: 2Ô∏è‚É£ Then create sound objects like cones, pyramids or icosahedrons near the mobile object
step11.hint3: 3Ô∏è‚É£ These objects activate automatically when the mobile object passes over them
step11.hint4: 4Ô∏è‚É£ Edit the mobile object parameters (speed, trajectory) from the right panel

step12.title: Save and Load Projects
step12.description: Save your current composition so you can retrieve it later.
step12.action: Save the current composition using the persistence panel
step12.success: Excellent! You now know how to save and load your projects.
step12.failure: Save your composition using the 'SAVE PROJECT' button in the persistence panel.
step12.hint1: ‚ûï Click 'NEW' to create an empty project
step12.hint3: üìÇ You can load previously saved projects
step12.hint4: üåê Your projects are saved in the cloud

step13.title: Create Your Sound Sculpture!
step13.description: You now have all the tools to create a complex sound sculpture. Experiment with different sound objects, effect zones and mobile objects to build your unique composition.
step13.action: Use your creativity to build a complex sound sculpture
step13.success: Excellent work! Keep experimenting and creating!
step13.failure: Explore all possibilities and create something amazing!
step13.hint1: üé® Combine different types of sound objects
step13.hint2: üéöÔ∏è Use effect zones to add spatial depth
step13.hint3: üîÑ Create mobile objects to generate dynamic movement
step13.hint4: üé≠ Experiment with different materials and visual textures
step13.hint5: üéµ Adjust audio parameters to create unique atmospheres
